1.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

2.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
knowledge
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

to cover over (the mouth), i.e. to fast
